definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve

sentences.english: The devastated old China is gone for ever.
sentences.chinese: 疮痍满目的旧中国一去不复返了。

sentences.english: I am certain, after 14 years of encounters with the Taliban, that they are not beyond redemption.
sentences.chinese: 遭遇塔利班14年，我知道他们并没有万劫不复。

sentences.english: I'm sure Marr's right that newspapers as we know them are not going to survive.
sentences.chinese: 我可以肯定马尔的正确，如我们所知报纸将不复存在。

sentences.english: The golden school-time days have gone down in youth history and will not come back again.
sentences.chinese: 金色的学生时代，已载入了青春史册，一去不复还。

sentences.english: The good old days of “Our Friend the Atom” were gone for good.
sentences.chinese: 过去“原子是我们的朋友”美好时光也一去不复返了。

sentences.english: Gone are the days when the farmers were looked down upon.
sentences.chinese: 农民被人瞧不起的日子一去不复返了。

sentences.english: Gone are the days when the working people suffered from cold and hunger.
sentences.chinese: 劳动人民挨冻受饿的日子一去不复返了。

sentences.english: He understands that the days are gone when the party can maintain political stability with the muzzle of a gun.
sentences.chinese: 他知道一个政党靠枪杆子出政权的日子一去不复返了。

sentences.english: Or will MMV just cease to exist.
sentences.chinese: 抑或摩托罗拉移动风险投资将不复存在？

sentences.english: Easy money has turned into heavy debt.
sentences.chinese: 现在缓冲作用不复存在，快钱变成了沉重的债务。

sentences.english: 10th, Meng Xiangbin The wind whinny, the river water is cold, the brave soldier never to returns.
sentences.chinese: 风萧萧，江水寒，壮士一去不复返。

sentences.english: If on Candlemas day it be shower and rain, winter is gone, and will not come again.
sentences.chinese: 如果圣烛节下冰雹和雨水，冬天已经一去不复返。

sentences.english: This effect would be absent if the sley dwelt during the period of shuttle flight.
sentences.chinese: 如果梭子飞行期间筘座停顿，这种效果便不复存在了。

sentences.english: Gone are the days when we used foreign oil.
sentences.chinese: 咱们利用洋油的日子一去不复返了。

sentences.english: This path is no longer a path.

definition: to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
vanished from the face of the earth/all gone/nothing left
variant of 蕩然|荡然[dang4 ran2]
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
things have remained the same, but people have changed
